result.execSummary:
The defendant Austin James Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Bond amount posted shall be applied.  lf extended supervision is revoked and the defendant will have a mandatory release from prison, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due. 

Defendant shall provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.

Defendant shall comply with and successfully complete all aspects of the Washington County Drug Treatment Court Program.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments, and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent and comply with recommendations.

timeConds.notes: Stayed and to be used at discretion of the Drug Treatment Court Judge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Austin James Smith
